text: There is no pain to compare with what a parent experiences when their child is very sick or dying. I did the rodeo thing when I was a young man and my body has been "broke in the middle and on both ends". But dealing with my own injuries and pain was an easy experience compared to what I experienced when my younger son was dying. He fought like a lion for his life. But he was born with serious heart problems...best doctors and best hospital in the entire world. It was not enough to save him. I can still remember his last haircut. And I kick myself when I do because I did not save a bit of his hair. I think his Mom did...but when he passed it put her health problems into overdrive and she soon followed him to the afterlife. I did not find any of his hair in her stash of "precious memories". It is after 5pm...I'm gonna get something to drink. Maybe I can find something to occupy my mind and stop fretting over stuff I can not change.
